channel.title: Comments on: Backup and copy warm-standby (log shipped) databases in SQL Server
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Huon
item.dc:creator: Huon
item.content:encoded:
I had to do this for a database with multiple data files. I had to change the CREATE DATABASE statement to create two data files, otherwise bring the db online would fail looking for the secondary data file. Here’s the modified statement:

<br />
CREATE DATABASE bah<br />
ON<br />
PRIMARY ( NAME = 'bah_data', FILENAME = 'E:\Temp\bah.mdf'),<br />
( NAME = 'bah_1_data', FILENAME = 'E:\Temp\bah_1.mdf')<br />
LOG ON<br />
( NAME = 'bah_log',<br />
   FILENAME = 'E:\Temp\bah.ldf' )<br />
GO<br />

Additionally, when I brought the database online, I got this warning:

“The Service Broker in database “bah” will be disabled because the Service Broker GUID in the database (256D7E33-1FA0-437B-B8DF-7A7AE735C3B8) does not match the one in sys.databases (116A14FA-05CC-4F3D-9C8C-94AB72CCC597).”

I googled the solution to this, which is to reset the service broker (http://grumpydba.blogspot.com.au/2011/09/service-broker-guid-does-not-match-one.html):

<br />
ALTER DATABASE bahSET NEW_BROKER WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE<br />
GO<br />

item.title: By: Bernard
item.dc:creator: Bernard
item.description:
HI, i know this post is quite old, but maybe you can help. I have a database in transaction log shipping mode. i tried your method for the secondary server, in order to have a backup of it. But it doesn't work: after detaching the secondary server and copying the files over, i do manage to bring the secondary server back online in standby mode, but the files i copied to the new instance, where i created a Db and put it offline, i can't attached the copied files to it, the error i get:
Unable to open the physical file "d:\logdata\bah.ldf". Operating system error 5: "5(failed to retrieve text for this error. Reason: 15105)". File activation failure. The physical file name "d:\logdata\bah1.ldf" may be incorrect. The log cannot be rebuilt because there were open transactions/users when the database was shutdown, no checkpoint occurred to the database, or the database was read-only. This error could occur if the transaction log file was manually deleted or lost due to a hardware or environment failure.
Database 'bah' cannot be opened due to inaccessible files or insufficient memory or disk space. See the SQL Server errorlog for details.
i googled a lot and can't find a solution.
Your method did work if the database wasn't in TSL.

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.content:encoded:
Hi Ted.
Simply fascinating. I have tested using a db with one mdf/ldf. Perhaps you can comment on the following scenario:

The target (standby/ro) database (DB1) on (server B), is placed offline.
The underlying disk LUNs hosting (DB1) data/index/log files is snapshot via SAN snapshot and presented to another server (server C).
Can I bring the database online on server C using the files that have just been presented via the SAN snapshot?

TIA,
John

item.description: Yes, that would work although you would be sharing resources with the two instances so just be mindful of that :)
